author: Reuters Editorial
title: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St edges lower after N.Korea summit canceled
text:
NEW YORK, May 24 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks ended down slightly on Thursday after President Donald Trump canceled a planned summit with North Koreaâ€™s Kim Jong Un and ordered a probe of auto imports, while gains in Netflix pushed its market value to a record.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 75.05 points, or 0.3 percent, to 24,811.76, the S&P 500 lost 5.53 points, or 0.20 percent, to 2,727.76 and the Nasdaq Composite dropped 1.53 points, or 0.02 percent, to 7,424.43. (Reporting by Caroline Valetkevitch, editing by G Crosse)
